As our Sales Coordinator in the Offshore Business Unit, you will be part of the sales project team, where you will coordinate and provide administrative support to the sales processes externally and internally. You are responsible for managing the documentation and supporting the Sales Project Managers and the rest of the sales team throughout offer preparation, offer submission and negotiation phases.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As our new Sales Coordinator, your responsibilities will include:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Providing administrative support and document control during bid-preparation and negotiation phase<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Preparation and compiling of tender material<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordination of activities in the Sales Project Team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintenance of task lists and keeping track of deliverables<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Responsibility for sales project sites on SharePoint, including permissions and access control<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordination of accesses and updates of customer’ portals\u002Fdocument databases<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinating and facilitating offer submission (including proof-read)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinating and facilitating contract review process and contract deliver<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Performing language and quality check<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Preparing sales audits (internal and external)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. implementation of strategies to minimize risk and realize opportunities\n     <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li>\n     <div>\n <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Are you energetic, passionate for new challenges and can adapt to a dynamic work environment?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Dimension of function\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The CSC contributes to the safe execution of projects on site on behalf of Site Management. The CSC is primarily responsible for the daily planning and execution within individual area and functions of the construction site, as directed by the Site Manager.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   By joining our team, you will be our Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy staff colleague and you will be part of our very enthusiastic and dedicated Site Resource Sourcing (SRS) group represented in Denmark, Germany, UK, The Netherlands, France, Taiwan and US.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Mobility &amp; work pattern\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The CSC position mostly works in rotation patterns of 2 weeks on\u002F2 weeks off. This means you need to be willing and able to relocate to site locations in Europe in accordance with this rotation pattern.We could also be looking at periods of time where you will be working a Monday to Friday shift.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Stakeholders\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The CSC is a key interface to all Site Team members, visitors, clients, and back office and must always maintain good relationships. The CSC is authorized to make corrections, changes, or rejections within the assigned area of responsibility to ensure compliance with and adherence to SGRE procedures and policies.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Areas of Responsibility\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Collect and verify different data from multiple sources, consolidate various data reports, as DPRs, and distribute to relevant stakeholders. Provide feedback to data owner in case of deviations. Monitor, verify and correct reports prior to submittal, such as time registration overviews, KPI reports, vendor reports, crew change lists, etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Arrange transport and accommodation for site personnel travelling to\u002Ffrom Project in line with Project specific transport concept. Organize and manage crew changes to\u002Ffrom specific site location by producing crew change manifests per defined format based on manning plans. Coordinate with Site Management and Marine Coordinator and update transport manifests.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Act as first point of contact towards visitors and site personnel to\u002Ffrom site, as receptionist including reporting, data entry, keeping visitor log and answering phone calls.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Organize, arrange, and coordinate meetings on site. Prepare, distribute, and file meeting minutes.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Comply with the Environment, Health &amp; Safety rules on Site. Active support through participation in toolbox talks and safety campaigns.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Track stock of office supplies and place orders when necessary. Support with ad hoc clerical tasks.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> PO creation and budget checking when necessary.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Update and maintain records and databases, such as personnel data\u002Fcertificates\u002Fqualifications \u002Ftraining details into internal or customer system after verification of validity and of compliance.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Execute Site administrative activities and operations to secure efficiency and compliance with company policies.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assist and train colleagues when necessary.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Willing to work through holidays, when necessary.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The role requires flexibility to travel as needed.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Expert within business administration - structured and organized<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Advanced communication skills in multicultural environments<\u002Fli>\n  <li> English language proficiency<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Customer-oriented and service-minded<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Advanced IT Skills - MS Outlook, Office 365 (Word, Excel, OneDrive). Not required but beneficial: SAP (SRP)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Team player<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Self-motivated and trustworthy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Schedule and time management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Quality oriented<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Safety awareness<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Analysis\u002Fstatistics<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Other beneficial skills\u002Fexperiences: knowledge and interest in industry - wind turbine industry, construction projects, offshore work (vessel based)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Qualifications:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Professional - proven experience as office \u002F business administrator, assistant, or relevant role. Qualifications in secretarial studies will be an advantage.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Project\u002FProcess - familiarity with office management procedures and preferably within the Offshore Wind Industry.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Intercultural - living and working experience in an intercultural environment.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Capabilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Team Skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to Learn<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Communication Skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Customer Focus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Detail-oriented<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Adaptable<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organisation. Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable) and local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We believe diversity creates more opportunity for success. That’s why we recruit great minds from all walks of life: it doesn’t matter the gender, age, ethnic background, sexual orientation, or disability. Our main aim is to find people from around the globe who can contribute to world-changing technology.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Please apply in English via the apply button\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For further information regarding the recruitment process, please send the primary recruiter Aysegul Izgi, an email via aysegul.izgi.ext@siemensgamesa.com Please mention the Job ID in the email.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We kindly draw your attention to the fact that this email may NOT be used for sending applications or CVs for evaluation\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity\u002Fexpression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We adhere to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, promotion and benefits.<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i><br> We are driven by people - from more than 100 different countries, they build the company we are every day. We value the flexibility that our smart-working arrangements, our digital disconnection framework and our family-friendly practices bring to the new way of working.<\u002Fi>\n <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    We are now recruiting for a Site Manager position for Offshore Construction. The primary purpose of this role will be the responsibility and authority for the safe and economical execution of the works at a specific construction site location. This role reports to the Head of Site Management and Installation Leads (SMIL).\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    How to contribute to our vision\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    The Site Manager has the directive and decision-making authority for all operations at the construction site location as well as towards all personnel present at that location. The Site Manager reports directly to the project responsible Lead Site Manager on a daily basis and functionally to the Head of SMIL.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    You will in accordance with the contract and EHS \u002F QA systems be responsible for the planning and execution of works at a specific location of the construction site as directed by the Lead Site Manager. You will ensure that all work is performed in agreement with all SGRE standards and regulations. You will perform continuous evaluation and feedback of the individuals within your teams to ensure capabilities and skills are maintained and where necessary improved to the required standards. You will ensure the implementation, continuous improvement and optimising of processes, workflows and standards to standardize execution and create a safe working environment.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    Some of your key tasks will include but not be limited to:\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Provide visible, strong and active EHS leadership within the project, acting as a champion of Zero Harm. Responsible to ensure the issuance of EHS standards, regulations and procedures to ensure a Zero Harm environment and to perform within your leading function as a role model.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support and contribute to EHS matters in the various planning meetings during the project planning phase and then ensuring the assessment, documentation and certification process are in place during the project execution phase.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for ensuring that activities at site comply with company and project targets in regard to safety, schedule, cost and quality. In case of deviations then responsible for developing and implementing countermeasures whilst providing transparency for early warnings for escalation and reporting.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for the implementation and execution of change and claim management, as well as cost out measures, ensuring that the quality of work undertaken results in no additional non-standard work, by driving a Zero Defect culture in all areas.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for risk and opportunity management.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure the planning and coordination of all site activities and establish and implement a regular reporting regime.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for the site setup planning, mobilisation and demobilisation of the construction site location and in accordance with requirements the maintenance of tools, equipment and machinery during execution.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for the implementation of 24ONE99 workflows and related construction standards and cost out measure<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    What you need to make a difference\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    The successful candidate will either have a University degree in a relevant subject and \u002F or have +6 years of professional experience in the Offshore wind industry and +2 years in a similar role.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    You will be an experienced leader with proven track record in large international construction projects and possessing in-depth technical knowledge of wind turbine products and related logistics. You will be able to handle conflicts and be a solution orientated individual who can understand technical issues, work processes and activities at site and who is a team player able to maintain high performing teams.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    You will have a solid understanding of the work processes at project sites, with broad planning, production, assembly and commissioning know-how as well as in-depth knowledge of business planning and the business process. You will also be EHS and Quality focussed and be able to identify risks before they happen and have solid knowledge and understanding of SGRE Sphera, QA and EHS processes.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    To be successful in this role, you will have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal – advanced in the English language. Lastly, as this role requires you to work and be based at our project sites globally, you will be willing and able to travel anywhere as required, working on a rotational basis both onshore and offshore.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n     In return of your commitment we offer you…\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n     Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n     We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n     We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div><\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n     Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable) and local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n future?\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div><\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n      Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As Commercial Manager you will take role in preparation of commercial and legal conditions contracts with clients, consortia partners and suppliers, carry out respective negotiations and claim management. In the meantime, you will have the accountability for project controlling, forecasts and reporting.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Additionally,\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Ensures the compliance with the LoA guidelines for all commercial aspects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensures the accuracy of project books and records, including recording of such in the appropriate systems, e.g. SAP - ensures compliance with Siemens-FRG plus the local Gaap requirements. Ensures all related Project Reporting and Controlling activities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports the Project Manager that the financial results according to set targets are managed with due professional care and optimizes the project gross profit, cash flow and assets and financing instruments.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Actively communicates with customer's commercial representatives and manages solving of commercial issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Together with the PM proactively setting up a contract and claim management in the project, including involvement and cooperation with the assigned contract manager.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports the PM in identifying, evaluating and assessing risk and opportunities, strategies and response activities – taking over the full responsibility in this regard with respect to all commercial risks and opportunities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports Project Manager to select and involve partners \u002F subcontractors.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Represents the project in the relevant decision boards internally and externally.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Agrees targets with commercial project staff and delegates defined responsibilities and authority.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Leads commercial project team members to act according to the Business Conduct Guidelines and establishes a culture of trust and integrity.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Also,\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> You should be located in Gdansk\u002FPoland.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Specialization in project management, controlling, contract management will be an asset.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong Leadership skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You need to be fluent in English and Polish.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You should be flexible\u002F<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Plus, you need to be capable at multitasking, analytical thinking, decision making. Last but not least, you need to have good communication skills and good teamwork spirit.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <br> We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <br> In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for an experienced and driven WTG Project Manager to join our global team in the Offshore Project Management organization at Siemens Gamesa. By joining us, you will become an essential part of a dynamic and multicultural project organization and join the core team of one of our large offshore wind projects. You will be located at our office in Gdansk, Poland.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As the WTG Project Manager, you are responsible for delivering the WTG Package in all project management aspects for one of our offshore windfarm projects. Your responsibilities include the on time, on budget and in high-quality delivery of the design, components, and project documentation. To achieve your goal, you handle the alignment of all turbine works between the internal and external stakeholders and are therefore a key member in the project team driving the activities. In the project, you report to the Project Director.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You lead a team of highly qualified engineering managers covering the different technical and functional aspects of delivering our wind turbines in industry-defining safety and quality, planning precision and to our customers’ full satisfaction.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The job requires you to support and develop your team with your experience and confidence, keeping the overview about priorities, acting as one to reach the project’s goals, getting further stakeholders to contribute and proactively following up on any lose ends or potential gaps in execution.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The WTG PM role is challenging and rewarding, and it provides many opportunities for personal and professional development beyond the levels you have already accomplished. You will be part of the Global WTG Project Management team in which we support each other to fulfill our duties within all projects, establish best practices and tackle project independent challenges together.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You are passionate for renewable energy and have a sense for the importance to make real what matters and lead the change.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for you to hold a relevant university degree, coupled with at least 5 years of relevant professional experience in an international industrial company. Ideally, your experience includes project, engineering, or fabrication management. You have excelled in your area of expertise, were able to show first potential in leadership and are ready to grow and broaden your horizon managing several engineering disciplines and interests in the project.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You have a driven personality and are known to proactively follow up to make things happen. You are systematic, enabling you to manage a range of complex project requirements, risks, and costs within the given timeline. You communicate clearly and reach firm agreements with stakeholders. You can lead a team of qualified individuals and are capable to inspire confidence and a sense of pride and achievement into what you accomplish as a team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You are comfortable using a variety of IT systems to fulfill different aspects of your scope (e.g. design system, project documentation, cost management). Your English skills are excellent, both orally and in writing; business level Polish is considered an advantage.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are an equal opportunity employer and aim to increase diversity in our team of WTG Project managers. We welcome applications from candidates of a variety of backgrounds no matter gender, race, religion, age, nationality or sexual orientation.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as 50\u002F50 office and home-office split, attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable) and local benefits such as subsided lunch, fitness club card and much more.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Other information\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   If you have specific questions about the position, please contact the hiring manager Joachim Beyer via phone +49 172 172 3122697 or email \n  <div>\n   joachim.beyer@siemensgamesa.com\n  <\u002Fdiv>.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For further information regarding the recruitment process, please contact the primary recruiter Nadine Borges through email: \n  <div>\n   nadine.nb.borges.ext@siemensgamesa.com\n  <\u002Fdiv>.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Please mention the Job ID in the email.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Please apply in English via the apply button.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We kindly draw your attention to the fact that this email may NOT be used for sending applications or CVs for evaluation.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   #Mid-Senior\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a Classifier, you will be responsible for the assignment of Trade Master Data to Siemens Gamesa products, to ensure compliance with international trade activities. An important part of the role will be the determination of applied customs tariff and export control number, in line with product specifications, the General Rules of Interpretation of the nomenclature and the ECCN list.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will be in direct contact with various internal and external stakeholders worldwide and will support on customs related topics and audits.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Other responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Ensure data consistency within defined product categories and across various systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Contribute to ECC optimization of processes and systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participate in community meetings and internal calls to best support the business and to create ECC awareness<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Offer support in data migration activities and inter-related projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Systems (SAP) updates and reporting<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Archiving and maintenance of activity\u002Fchange trackers<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The ideal candidate holds a university degree in the area of Engineering, Logistics\u002FInternational Trade, Business Management or similar and have 5+ years of experience as classifier. Certification on Tariff Determination and Export Control Classification is considered as a plus.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   To be successful in this role you preferably:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> have experience with classifying products that fall under nomenclature chapters 84, 85 \u002F inclusion, exclusion, BTIs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have a good understanding of and experience with classification of hardware and software (HS and ECCN)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have good knowledge or at a minimum are familiar to ECC list \u002F export license determination.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have good understanding of Wind Industry and wind turbine functionality \u002F experience with reading technical drawings and technical specifications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are detail\u002Fsolution-oriented, well-structured, extremely resourceful team player with excellent analytical skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have good interpersonal skills and capable of working with people from diverse backgrounds, cultures and organizational levels<\u002Fli>\n  <li> possess a strong work ethic and able to solve problems creatively<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have experience in the use of SAP and proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> have excellent English skills, highly proficient in both spoken and written, Spanish or German will be a plus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> can travel mainly within Europe (up to 25% of their time if needed)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa offers local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and more.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Other information\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For further information regarding the recruitment process, please send the primary recruiter, Aysu Melis GUNDUZ, an email via aysu.gunduz.ext@siemensgamesa.com. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join us in creating a better future for our planet.\n <br> \n <br> We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <br> \n <br> In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organisation.\n <br> \n <br> How to contribute to our vision\n <br> \n <br> Are you energetic and have the ability to work under pressure and take responsibility for your own workload?\n <br> \n <br> Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy is looking for an Installation Lead for Offshore Construction. The primary purpose of this role will be responsibility for the first line supervision and direction of the teams assigned to you and to ensure the safe, timely and effective execution of the work activities. This role reports to the Head of Site Management and Installation Leads.\n <br> \n <br> You will be responsible for the daily planning and execution of works within an individual area and function of the construction site as directed by Site Management. You will ensure that all work is performed in agreement with all Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy standards including QA regulations. You will perform continuous evaluation and feedback of the technicians within your teams to ensure capabilities and skills are maintained and where necessary improved to the required standards. You will implement, continuously improve and optimize processes, workflows and standards to standardize execution and create a safe working environment.\n <div>\n   Some of your key tasks will include but not be limited to:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Provide visible, strong and active EHS leadership within the project, acting as a champion of Zero Harm. Responsible to ensure that EHS standards, procedures and plans are implemented, to create a Zero Harm environment and to perform within your leading function as a role model.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support and contribute to EHS matters in the various planning meetings during the project planning phase and then ensuring the assessment, documentation and certification process is in place during the project execution phase.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure all personnel operating within your area of responsibility (including contractors) are competent to undertake their work and are aware of all EHS related information.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure work proceeds in accordance with all required documentation, permits, RAMS, etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure that the quality of work undertaken by your teams result in no additional non-standard work, by driving a Zero-Defect culture in all areas.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure full adherence to Lean workflows, reporting on deviations and implementing remedial measures to prevent reoccurrence – drive, implement and manage the Lean process throughout all areas.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure correct allocation of registered working hours for the teams. Monitor, control and mitigate all excessive working hours at site<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   A passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Candidate who will be an experienced leader with proven track record in large international manufacturing or industrial environments and possessing in-depth technical knowledge of wind turbine products.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will be able to handle conflicts and be a solution orientated individual who can understand technical issues, work processes and activities at site and who is a team player able to maintain high performing teams.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will have experience of working within the Offshore industry and have a solid understanding of the work processes at project sites.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will also be EHS and Quality focused and be able to identify risks before they happen and have solid knowledge and understanding of Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Sphere, QA and EHS processes.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> To be successful in this role, you will have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal along with Wind Industry experience which is a must .<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lastly, as this role requires you to work and be based at our project sites globally, you will be willing and able to travel anywhere as required, working on a rotational basis both onshore and offshore.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organisation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Employer-funded pension<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organisation. Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable) and local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We believe diversity creates more opportunity for success. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for a strong Project Manager for the fabrication phase in offshore wind farm projects.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Fabrication Manager belongs to the project teams headed by the Senior Project Manager or Project Director. The Fabrication Manager is, with reference to the WTG Project Manager, acting as responsible for the Fabrication Package during sourcing and production of Nacelles \u002F Blades \u002F Towers and other components for the wind turbines.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Fabrication Manager's background is ideally hands-on experience from production plants and project management experience either within the wind industry or from the construction industry or companies producing machinery and equipment.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The right person is structured and systematic with production understanding and good ability to create overview and quickly see critical paths and identify challenges related to production &amp; sourcing of main components.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Based on the Fabrication Managers analytical and structured approach, the Fabrication Managers plans the activities for which they are responsible - and subsequently follows up with the project team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Fabrication Managers have experience in motivating and guiding stakeholders both within the project team and with other stakeholders and must have a customer focused mindset.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What are my responsibilities?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Be the customer interface to SGRE for the manufacturing of Turbine components.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ensure all deliverables are met in the project gateway process.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     For the fabrication scope monitor changes load plans to mitigate \u002F align \u002F escalate as necessary. Ensure progress reporting internally and externally.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Implement project requirements towards suppliers in corporation with internal Procurement.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Prepare and execute First Article Inspections, Factory Acceptance Tests manufacturing surveillance and inspections with Project QA Manager, the supplier, 3rd party certifier and customer at manufacturing facilities.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ensure implementation of Project specific production and quality requirements.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Follow up on Non-Conformances or deviation \u002F concession request changes that effect the production of project components with required stakeholders.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Follow up on Engineering Change Notification implementation to ensure implementation at the earliest opportunity.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Coordinate across the project (Transport Manager) to ensure alignment on deliveries to pre-assembly installation sites.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     You hold a BSc or MSc in mechanical, construction, manufacturing or off-shore engineering.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     You have experience in project management and hands-on experience with production plants.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     As a person you are proactive with a detail and process-oriented mindset.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     You like to work in a complex international environment having excellent English skill both orally and in writing\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Being able to travel. The travel activities vary a lot during the project timeline and depending on the project.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     You are like to work with many stakeholders internally as well as externally.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     You are familiar with normal office and IT-tools\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> In case you have acquired your skills in alternative ways your application is just as well appreciated.<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As our new EHS Manager in Projects (EMiP), you support the project organization in all legal compliance matters including EHS \u002F HSE procedures and policies and client\u002Fcontractual requirements. You are responsible for identifying and ensuring EHS compliance and continuous improvement in all aspects of the project’s on- and offshore work scope including implementation of the Project EHS Plan. In this role you act as the Project Manager’s counsellor on EHS and you are therefore also responsible for communicating critical EHS issues to the EHS line management back office function. You are a member of the project management team and you report directly and functionally to the Project Manager.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> With functional management responsibility for the EHS Advisors, you are responsible for coordinating the work scope of the EHS Advisors designated to the project including instructing these in methods for monitoring, inspection and follow-up in connection with site specific issues; e.g. as result of accidents and incidents<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Your overall responsibility is to ensure that all necessary EHS project documentation is prepared in due time in compliance with internal, client and statutory requirements throughout the different project phases from planning to final handover<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You not only have the full authority but also a continuous obligation to constantly verify that the immediate safety of all project personnel is fully obtained. This means that at any time you are empowered to order a work operation to be ceased if necessary in order to avoid an unsafe condition<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Due to the nature of the scope of this role, it is necessary that you plan your work in such way that physical coverage of the project is obtained at all times. This means that frequent on-site visits shall be planned as an integrated part of the work schedule, which should include carrying out e.g. site and vessel inspections in cooperation with the EHS advisors<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> You ideally hold a technical university degree (mechanical Engineering, civil engineering or industrial engineering) or equivalent<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have several years of experience in working within Environmental, Health and Safety (EHS) projects within the wind\u002Fenergy sector or a similar environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You bring profound knowledge of EHS guidelines and processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are able to apply risk assessment methods and their application for specific hazards. Knowledge of qualitative and quantitative methods for estimating levels of risk, including issues and limitations is also familiar to you.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are able to apply decision making on risk<\u002Fli>\n  <li> As a person you are open-minded, solution-oriented and proactive with a constant focus on safety<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Your English and Polish skills are excellent<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You possess strong communication and presentation skills, as well as willingness to travel<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as 50\u002F50 office and home-office split, attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable) and local benefits such as subsided lunch, fitness club card and much more.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Other information\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For further information regarding the recruitment process, please contact the primary recruiter Aysu Gunduz through email: \n  <div>\n   aysu.gunduz.ext@siemensgamesa.com\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Please mention the Job ID in the email.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Please apply in English via the apply button.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We kindly draw your attention to the fact that this email may NOT be used for sending applications or CVs for evaluation.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity\u002Fexpression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We adhere to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, promotion and benefits.<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i><br> We are driven by people - from more than 100 different countries, they build the company we are every day. We value the flexibility that our smart-working arrangements, our digital disconnection framework and our family-friendly practices bring to the new way of working.<\u002Fi>\n Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join us in creating a better future for our planet.\n <br> We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <br> In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <br> For our Business Intelligence Team within Offshore Construction, we are looking for a Business Analyst to support on Business reporting, Operational analytics &amp; Process improvement initiatives.\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a Business Analyst you will be given the challenge to create insights and find optimization potentials along the Offshore construction value chain in order to extend our market position to a global scale.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> You analyze process efficiency, deliver insights and support improvement projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You move the organization from a reactive to proactive view and ensuring insights are backed with data<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have an agile mindset and focus and value creation and fast delivery cycles<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You understand business requirements in BI context and design data models to transform raw data into meaningful insights.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You create dashboards and interactive visual reports using Power BI.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You design, develop, test, and deploy Power BI scripts and perform detailed analytics.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> In collaboration with the rest of the team, you help structure reporting portfolio to improve visualization and secure alignment across reports.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for an early professional having:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> A Bachelors degree STEM, IT or Finance or similar.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work experience as Analyst for business processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Passion for finding ways to improve the quality and efficiency of work, and not settling for “good enough\"<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strength at critically evaluating information, generating solutions, and using facts, logic, and experience to support decisions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Passionate about data analytics and visualization of data.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> An open and collaborative mindset, willing to support and take on tasks where needed.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Team player eager to learn new things.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Fluent in English both written and oral.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n  <br> \n  <br> In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity, and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n  <br> \n  <br> How to contribute to our vision\n  <br> \n  <br> We are looking for a Sales Project Manager to support in our market unit Offshore, focused on new turbine sales based out of Warsaw office. Within this high-profile role, you will be responsible for managing the sales phase for our contribution to some of the largest and most exciting global renewable energy projects.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a senior team member, you will be influencing, motivating, supporting, and developing a high performing sales project team, creating a frame for success in a highly paced and very professional environment. In relation to this, you will be setting clear targets for team members, tracking progress, and ensuring timely delivery. You will understand customer requirements, develop bid\u002Fnegotiation strategies and secure agreement from senior management on technical, commercial, and legal matters.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Some of your key tasks will include but not be limited to:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Overall responsibility for Sales projects during Sales phase including Bid Preparation, Offer submission and contract negotiation\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Developing a detailed understanding of customer requirements and reflecting these within associated bid\u002Fnegotiation strategies\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Building technical, commercial, and legal solutions which align with customer requirements and internal business objectives\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Internal presentation to senior managers using your leadership skills to secure the buy-in and support of stakeholders from across the business\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Setting clear targets for team members, tracking progress, and ensuring timely delivery\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Responsibility for project planning, reporting and follow up\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ensuring successful handover to Project Management upon contract signature\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Inspiring, leading by example and finding solutions to solutions arising from this dynamic and competitive market environment\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <br> We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <br> In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <br> \n <br> You will join our New Product Engineering team in Offshore Equipment which is responsible for cutting-edge technology designs for all standard lifting and transport solution for our new Offshore turbines. The team is closely cooperating with the turbine development modules, making sure all brand-new turbine designs can be transported and lifted in the future on time and on cost.\n <br> New Product Engineering team in Offshore Equipment is also closely linked to the Sales &amp; Execution organization which takes care of all customer, country, and harbor specific requirements.\n <br> The team is based in Gdansk\u002FPoland with cooperation partners and co-workers based in Denmark, Germany and India. The team works in a very inspiring multi-cultural environment to the highest standards.\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   To strengthen our Engineering Team, you can contribute with an eye and focus on developing innovative designs and technology concepts for new transport &amp; lifting equipment for the next generations of wind turbines keeping up with their steady increase in size and weight in a cost-efficient manner. In addition, it would be required an open mind on checking existing equipment for suitability with new requirements and developing retrofit solutions if required as well as continuous new technologies search for our new equipment designs. But most importantly a critical technical alignment with various stakeholders throughout SGRE would be a must.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for a design focused engineer with a MSc in Mechanical, Marine, Civil, or similar Engineering combined with 4-5 years of relevant work experience in wind turbines, ship building, lifting equipment development or similar. Knowledge in Design and Manufacturing Processes in this area, including but not limited to bolt connections, welds and rigging by hand and understands the physics behind. In case you have acquired your skills in alternative ways your application is just as well appreciated.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Furthermore, you like to\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Prepare a concept design based on experience.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Calculate simple and semi-complex structures in FE beam-software.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Use ANSYS for the remaining highly complex and non-linear structures and load cases.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Use advanced Excel and Matlab\u002FPython\u002FOctave or similar<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a person you are proactive and structured, and you have a holistic mindset and strong analytic skills. You have an inherent ownership feeling and drive to get things done and you are never shy to take responsibility. To thrive in our large international organization, it helps to be a dedicated team player, independent and a skilled communicator with good networking skills and excellent English skills, both orally and in writing.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you...\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable) and local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Other information\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For further information regarding the recruitment process, please contact the primary recruiter Rory Scott through email: \n  <div>\n   rory.scott.ext@siemensgamesa.com\n  <\u002Fdiv>. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For our Logistic\u002FPlanning team within the Tools and Equipment Management department, we are looking for a Logistic Coordinator to be responsible for balancing demand and supply of transport equipment for our Off-Shore factories and installation projects worldwide. You will be working at our office in Gdansk, Poland. You will be in close cooperation with customers (factories and sites) based worldwide.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a Logistic Coordinator you will be responsible for following up and align the factories production plans and the projects installation plans to balancing demand and supply ensuring high utilization of the equipment and at the same time minimize transport cost.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   More specifically, your main responsibilities will cover:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Maintaining and optimizing all processes related to the logistical setup optimizing demand and supply of transport equipment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Monitoring the demand and supply plans ensuring delivery performance throughout the value chain<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reflect all demand plans and return plans in our ERP\u002FSAP system in cooperation with colleagues from factories and installation sites based globally and within the Equipment function, e.g. warehouses and order management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensuring that all functions are performed within regulatory guidelines and company procedures<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Continuously improving our administrative processes in relation to financial aspects and internal customer satisfaction<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Besides a passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change, we are also looking for:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You to have a bachelor or master’s degree within Supply Chain Management, Logistics, IT or something similar.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You have a degree in Supply Chain Management and Logistics and\u002For experience with these fields, combined with a technical affinity and a strong logistical understanding.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a person you are outgoing and proactive, have an analytical mindset, and you possess strong organizational, coordination and communication skills.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Besides, you are a dedicated team player capable of creating and keeping an overview of complex tasks.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You are fluent in English both orally and in writing, and you possess skills in Microsoft Office and knowledge of SAP.\n generations to come. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy (SGRE) has a vision for renewable energy: We believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> We are looking for a talented and driven Junior Turbine Project Manager (Junior WTG PM) to join our global team in the Offshore Project Management organization at Siemens Gamesa. By joining us, you will become an essential part of a dynamic and multicultural project organization and join the core team of one of our large offshore wind projects. You will be located at our office in Gdansk, Poland.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n  <br> As the Junior WTG PM on one of our large offshore wind projects, you have the possibility to work with one of our Senior WTG PMs and to support the delivery of the WTG Package. That way, you are well on the way to develop into the WTG PM role and to have an impact on delivering our turbines on time, on budget and in high quality. To achieve your goal, you handle the alignment of all turbine works between the internal and external stakeholders driving the activities. In the project, you report to the Senior WTG Project Manager.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   On your project, you are part of the WTG Package team of highly qualified engineering managers. The team covers the different technical and functional aspects of delivering our wind turbines in industry-defining safety and quality, planning precision and to our customers’ full satisfaction. Your focus is to lead the team on complex tasks delegated to you by the WTG PM.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The WTG PM role is challenging and rewarding, and it provides many opportunities for personal and professional development. The job requires you to support and develop your team with your experience and confidence, keeping the overview about priorities, acting as one to reach the project’s goals, getting further stakeholders to contribute and proactively following up on any lose ends or potential gaps in execution.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will be part of the global WTG Project Management team where you will engage with your peer WTG Project Managers. In this team, we support each other to fulfill our duties within all projects, establish best practices and tackle project independent challenges together.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n  <br> You are passionate for renewable energy and have a sense for the importance to make real what matters and lead the change.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for professionals who hold a university degree, coupled with at least 3 years of relevant experience in an international industrial company. Ideally, your experience includes project, engineering, or fabrication management. For the Junior role we are specifically looking for talents who we can develop into leaders and project managers for our future business. You need to be ready to grow and broaden your horizon managing several engineering disciplines and interests in the project. Please note, that background in wind industry is not a must have. We will guide you to step into this fascinating role.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You have a driven personality and are known to proactively follow up to make things happen. You are systematic, enabling you to manage a range of complex project requirements, risks, and costs within the given timeline. You communicate clearly and reach firm agreements with stakeholders. You can lead a team of qualified individuals and are capable to inspire confidence and a sense of pride and achievement into what you accomplish as a team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> You are comfortable using a variety of IT systems to fulfill different aspects of your scope (e.g. design system, project documentation, cost management). You possess fluent English skills, both orally and in writing, business level Polish skills are considered an advantage.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> We are an equal opportunity employer and aim to increase diversity in our team of WTG Project managers. We welcome applications from candidates of a variety of backgrounds no matter gender, race, religion, age, nationality, or sexual orientation.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you…\n  <br> Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> This position is a major step into offshore wind industry. It will give you an exposure to design, manufacturing, installation, and commissioning processes of offshore wind turbines. It provides opportunity to work in world class Siemens Gamesa team as well as being close with SGRE customers.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as 50\u002F50 office and home-office split, attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable) and local benefits such as subsided lunch, fitness club card and much more.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n  <br> https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <br> How do you imagine the future?\n  <br> https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <br> Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n  <br> Other information\n  <br> If you have specific questions about the position, please contact the hiring manager Joachim Beyer via phone +49 172 3122697 or email joachim.beyer@siemensgamesa.com\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For further information regarding the recruitment process, please contact the primary recruiter Aysegul Izgi through email:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    aysegul.izgi.ext@siemensgamesa.com\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Please mention the Job ID in the email.\n  <br> Please apply in English via the apply button.\n  <br> We kindly draw your attention to the fact that this email may NOT be used for sending applications or CVs for evaluation.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity\u002Fexpression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations.
