<div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join us in creating a better future for our planet.\n <br> We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <br> In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Are you dedicated and committed person ?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Do you want to make a difference in the battle against climate change?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   There has never been a more exciting time to join the wind power sector, and we now have an opportunity for a Project Manager to join our business supporting our offshore windfarm construction projects.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will be responsible for the timely delivery of Offshore Wind Farm projects according to the commitments made to our customers and the internal expectations to safety, quality, time and budget. The projects are part of large infrastructure construction projects, and our customers are among the biggest utility companies in the world. Project duration can be several years and budgets above 1 billion.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will join a diverse Project management team and play an important role in a multi-cultural organization and will become our first offshore Project Manager in Poland. You will receive support from colleagues and management from other countries.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   This is varied role in which every single day will be different, brings new challenges and responsibilities. Some of the main areas you will lead are:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Managing the project from signing the project with the client and handover from sales; participating in the last client meetings together with sales enabling a smooth handover from sales to execution.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Full empowerment and profit\u002Floss responsibility for results.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Setting necessary measures to ensure zero harm in health, safety and environment throughout the project. Ensuring compliance to standards, rules and regulations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Working closely with our customers; actively communicate with customer’s senior representatives and managing customer satisfaction, expectations and issue resolution.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Leading your project team; guide, support, motivate and develop team members to achieve project \u002F organization goals.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Delivering projects safely within the framework of company guidelines, mitigating the commercial, contractual and project risks. Driving business case, schedule and quality optimization and seek opportunities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensuring optimal technical and commercial solutions to overcome challenges.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   A passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> You to place high importance on working safely and lead with health and safety at the forefront of your mind.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You to be a superb stakeholder manager and communicator who can build strong relationships with both colleagues and customers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> We want you to be able to demonstrate your leadership skills and ability to establish a culture of trust, both internally and externally.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have demonstrable experience of managing large scale projects ideally within the energy sector.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have the understanding and experience of working within a large, complex and ideally multi-national organization.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have the ability to challenge from a technical and contractual perspective.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are structured and systematic, and you possess excellent problem-solving skills and are constantly looking for opportunities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ideally you will be qualified to degree level with minimum eight years of relevant work experience and it is meritorious if you have a IPMA project management certification<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will have the opportunity for travel within this role and must be flexible to accommodate these requirements.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You possess excellent English and Polish skills, both orally and in writing.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join us in creating a better future for our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our Offshore Construction Business Improvements and Strategic Projects team is looking for an energetic and highly motivated Project Manager to join our team!\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As Project Manager for Business Improvement and Strategic Projects within Offshore Construction (CNS), you will drive important projects proactively with the Construction Management Team on strategy and selected Business Improvement topics. You will act as an internal consultant to the Construction Management. You will establish and align deliveries with key stakeholders and find solutions with the experts across different departments.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   More specifically, your assignments will include:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> You will take the lead in preparing strategy sessions and team workshops, support the management team in the development of strategy and associated communication campaigns<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will drive business decisions by proactively getting involved in new concepts and strategic relevant topics to support the management in bringing the ideas to paper, prepare decision papers and roll out campaigns.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will support the digitalization campaign in all areas of the department and play an active role in upgrading the CNS reporting and communication toolbox.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will manage a variety of stakeholders in the value chain to identify the best solution for the business.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will ensure the department head is fully informed of all relevant information and is efficiently prepared in good time prior to meetings, both with information and relevant presentation materials.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n  <br> What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for……\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> A degree within a relevant area, e.g., Strategy, Business (MBA), Engineering or similar education<\u002Fli>\n  <li> 5 years of relevant work experience e.g., consulting, general project management or change management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Advanced Project Management skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Entrepreneurial spirit: You take responsibility for your work and you possess strong coordination, collaboration and analytical skills with the attention to details.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong at critically evaluating information, generating solutions, and using facts, logic, and experience to facilitate decision making<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Team player and a natural networker with the ability to work with many different stakeholders and within a complex business.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Very good coaching \u002F mentoring skills as well as moderation \u002F problem solving skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent communication and language skills (English) – both orally and in writing<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Expert IT skills (MS Office 365, communication and presentation tools)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You love the fun and the challenge in the race of building some of the largest offshore wind farms in the world.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable) and local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Other information\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   If you have specific questions about the position, please contact the hiring manager Marco Zahn via phone +49 173 46 16 326.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For further information regarding the recruitment process, please contact primary recruiter,\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Selin Kanalici via \n  <div>\n   selin.kanalici.ext@siemensgamesa.com\n  <\u002Fdiv> Please mention the Job ID in the email.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Please apply in English via the apply button.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We kindly draw your attention to the fact that this email may NOT be used for sending applications or CVs for evaluation.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. You interact closely with the Project Manager, Commercial Project Manager, and Project Package Managers as well as perform regular senior management reporting on risk and opportunity developments.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n     Your responsibilities:\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li>\n     <div>\n       Join multiple project teams to communicate and implement the risk strategy and act as risk &amp; opportunity management key expert\n     <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n    <li>\n     <div>\n       Facilitate high quality decision-making and actions to improve project performance\n     <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n    <li>\n     <div>\n       Facilitate workshops and ongoing project reviews to identify, assess, and manage threats and opportunities\n     <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n    <li>\n     <div>\n       Influence portfolio optimization through effective management and reporting of threats and opportunities\n     <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n    <li>\n     <div>\n       Identify and plan relevant responses with the project teams’\n     <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n    <li>\n     <div>\n       Drive implementation of risk and opportunity awareness culture in offshore organization\n     <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n    <li>\n     <div>\n       Identify\u002Fimplement best practices contributing to the continuous improvement of processes, tools, training, and templates\n     <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n    <li>\n     <div>\n       Contribute, drive and support activities to continuously improve project performance\n     <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n     What you need to make a difference\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n     You have successfully completed an MSc or similar in management, business engineering, or natural science. Ideally we imagine that you have approximately 5 - 8 years of solid hands-on experience in the fields of Project and Risk Management and\u002For thorough experience within Offshore Wind or the Energy sector. Concrete practical experience within a relevant previous role is required for this role.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n     You are motivated by analytical work and have the desire to challenge status quo, and you have practical knowledge of Monte-Carlo models and interpreting the results (both cost and schedule). Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for an experienced Contract Implementation Manager to join our dedicated team based in Gdansk\u002FPoland, whose ultimate aim is to progress in a growing industry. You will have the opportunity to be involved in dynamic discussions in an ever-changing market, where every day is different, and every deal will bring its own, new challenges.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Supports accountable business partners in mastering contractual challenges at all stages of the project planning and execution process in close cooperation with Legal Counsel and Project Management.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   This position is responsible for the successful implementation &amp; execution of UK offshore contract terms and conditions. You are a key member of the project team mitigating against customer and sub-supplier contract risks, and claims arising from such risks. Establish and maintain robust relationships with internal and external partners and manage all assigned ongoing claim cases with regular updates through relevant tools and with required importance and priority, conduct Claim &amp; Contract Workshop with the project team along the project execution phases\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Some of the key areas we want you to be involved in include:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Manage contracts by tracking contractual obligations in order to minimize\u002Fprevent Customer claims along with looking for opportunities to claim where Customer obligations are not fulfilled.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Together with the Project Management Team suggest strategies, and prioritize how to mitigate against project risks – both towards Customer and Sub-suppliers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Receive and record incoming customer documentation related to contract terms and conditions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Secure that contract obligations from customer contracts are cascading down to subs-suppliers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Check and secure consistency of sub supplier contract terms with Customer contract terms<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Draft official correspondence between SGRE and its and Customers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assist and support making commercial change orders.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be part of overall project team using your expert knowledge of the contract terms and conditions and work closely with the Project Director and the Commercial Manager.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Evaluate claims against contractual obligations, coordinate and document findings and formal response to such claims<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Evaluate technical, commercial and legal aspects of claims and coordinate with relevant experts to conclude such evaluation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepare publish and present, key data extracts, preliminary and final findings in relations to claims<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support customer facing contacts with written communications, meetings and face to face discussions on high value complex claim topics<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintain assessment of the claim exposure and potential commercial impact of such and evaluate against any commercial provision<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maximize cost efficiency of claim settlements considering remedy deployment or commercial closure<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   A passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for …\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> You to have a Contract or Commercial Legal or Paralegal background preferred<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in contract management and knowledge in contract structure and content assessment for large value complex projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in assessment of obligations against contract requirements, preparing and publishing written responses to customer claims<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience with difficult claim discussions and settlement negotiations using both written and verbal communications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Building and fostering close relationships with both internal and external customers and colleagues<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of innovative thinking and approach to propose and deliver solutions for claim settlement and closure.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience with Uniform Commercial Code based contracts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> MS Office proficiency required<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join us in creating a better future for our planet.\n <br> We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <br> In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are now recruiting for an Installation Lead position for Offshore Construction. The primary purpose of this role will be responsibility for the first line supervision and direction of the teams assigned to you and to ensure the safe, timely and effective execution of the work activities. This role reports to the Head of Site Management and Installation Leads.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will be responsible for the daily planning and execution of works within an individual area and function of the construction site as directed by Site Management. You will ensure that all work is performed in agreement with all Siemens Gamesa standards including QA regulations. You will perform continuous evaluation and feedback of the technicians within your teams to ensure capabilities and skills are maintained and where necessary improved to the required standards. You will implement, continuously improve and optimize processes, workflows and standards to standardize execution and create a safe working environment.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Some of the tasks and responsibilities you can expect to be involved in include:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Provide visible, strong and active EHS leadership within the project, acting as a champion of Zero Harm. Responsible to ensure that EHS standards, procedures and plans are implemented, to create a Zero Harm environment and to perform within your leading function as a role model.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support and contribute to EHS matters in the various planning meetings during the project planning phase and then ensuring the assessment, documentation and certification process is in place during the project execution phase.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure all personnel operating within your area of responsibility (including contractors) are competent to undertake their work and are aware of all EHS related information.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure work proceeds in accordance with all required documentation, permits, RAMS, etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure that the quality of work undertaken by your teams result in no additional non-standard work, by driving a Zero Defect culture in all areas.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure full adherence to Lean workflows, reporting on deviations and implementing remedial measures to prevent reoccurrence – drive, implement and manage the Lean process throughout all areas.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure correct allocation of registered working hours for the teams. Monitor, control and mitigate all excessive working hours at site.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   A passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> The successful candidate will be an experienced leader with proven track record in large international manufacturing or industrial environments and possessing in-depth technical knowledge of wind turbine products; Prior experience (minimum 1-2 years) in a leadership position (such as a team lead position) is preferred<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will need to be an electrical skilled person<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will be able to handle conflicts and be a solution orientated individual who can understand technical issues, work processes and activities at site and who is a team player able to maintain high performing teams.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have experience (minimum 3 years) of working within the Offshore industry and have a solid understanding of the work processes at project sites.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are also EHS and Quality focused and be able to identify risks before they happen and have solid knowledge and understanding of Siemens Gamesa Sphera, QA and EHS processes.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> To be successful in this role, you should have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> As this role requires you to work and be based at our project sites globally, you will be willing and able to travel anywhere as required, working on a rotational basis both onshore and offshore.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable) and local benefits such as subsided lunch, fitness club card and much more.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Other information\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For further information regarding the recruitment process, please contact the primary recruiter Nazli Falay through email: \n  <div>\n   nazli.falay.ext@siemensgamesa.com\n  <\u002Fdiv>.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Please mention the Job ID in the email.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Please apply in English via the apply button.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We kindly draw your attention to the fact that this email may NOT be used for sending applications or CVs for evaluation.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   #Associate\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity\u002Fexpression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization. Read more about your future team and employees' stories \n  <div>\n   in our brochure\n  <\u002Fdiv>.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for a dedicated Automation Engineer to take a key role in the design and maintenance of the automation system used globally in Siemens Gamesa Wind Power plants to join our SCADA department in Vejle, Denmark.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As our Automation Engineer you will be working on Offshore Power Plants with project specific automation solutions both in sales and execution phase.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our work is project driven and you will have wide scale international interfaces to clients, suppliers and colleagues. More specifically, you will be responsible for:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> project specific design during execution. This includes clarification and design in collaboration with project teams and customers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> programming of PLC\u002FRTU (TIA Portal and Codesys)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> participate in Factory Acceptant Test and Site Acceptant Test<\u002Fli>\n  <li> design and test documentation<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. Ideally, you have a strong technical background and maybe a Bachelor’s degree in electrical power engineering or graduate in Automation Engineering, preferably combined with experience from the wind turbine business. You should also have experience with protocol like IEC101, IEC104, OPC-UA and IEC61850 and have general understanding for SCADA, IT\u002Fnetwork and communication systems.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a person, you are self-driven, dedicated team player, extrovert, systematic, analytical and able to create and maintain an overview of complex tasks. At the same time, you are good at networking, and you possess excellent communication skills in English.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Furthermore you:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> deliver high quality also under pressure.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> thrive in a multi-cultural environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> are motivated by working in a strong technical and customer-oriented environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You must expect travel activity of 10-20 days a year.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> In case you have acquired your skills in alternative ways your application is just as well appreciated.<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> In return of your commitment we offer you…\n  <br> Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n  <br> In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For our Offshore Construction department, we are now recruiting for a Project Manager- Harbor Development for our Port &amp; Harbor Services Team.\n  <br> The team is taking care of all logistic inside our fixed ports and responsible for planning of all construction activities on our Pre-Assembly Harbor.\n  <br> Being a part of Port &amp; Harbor Services means working for a global team in different regions.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a Project Manager Harbor Development , you will be responsible for planning, preparing, and coordinating of technical projects throughout all stages of the Q-gate process. You will support the Senior Harbor Sales Specialist in identifying most cost effective and efficient harbors. Additionally, you will support the Senior Harbor Specialist - NM with New Market Port selection with port capability analysis (GBP, Geotechnical studies, Selected Engineering partner assistance, operational setup) and logistics setup.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Some of the tasks and responsibilities you can expect to be involved in include:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Perform port surveys for pre-assembly, load- out, crew harbors and Manufacturing facilities quays<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support tender, procurement and project teams in port negotiations, technical and commercial reviews.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support Project Procurement in preparation of Lease Option Agreements &amp; Lease Agreements in alignment with Senior Harbor Sales Specialist<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Actively participate in the Sales handover to Projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Create and maintain strategic relationships with port owners, contractors, 3rd party suppliers &amp; operators.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supporting ad-hoc support requests from project and New Market Teams.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   A passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are also looking for\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Civil Engineering or Maritime Engineering background<\u002Fli>\n  <li> a relevant technical background with commercial flair or vice versa<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have a prior profound knowledge site and engineering, expert user AutoCAD, etc. 3d design<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have min. 3-5 years of experience, preferably from a similar position in an international organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You should be experienced in building strong relations, solving issues in a non-confrontational way<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are talented at multi stakeholder management and achieve your results through great negotiation skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> As a person, you are structured, but at the same time you thrive in a dynamic environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are persistent, solution oriented and you possess an intercultural understanding<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have excellent communication and English skills, both speaking and in writing<\u002Fli>\n  <li> People management and good communication capabilities, ability to inspire others showing commitment to achieving targets \u002F goals.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrates good decision-making skills and takes responsibility for decisions taken.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Can develop an environment in which others can work to the best of their abilities allowing creative and innovative thoughts and ideas<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as 50\u002F50 office and home-office split, attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable) and local benefits such as subsided lunch, fitness club card and much more.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Other information\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For further information regarding the recruitment process, please contact the primary recruiter Nazli Falay through email: \n  <div>\n   nazli.falay.ext@siemensgamesa.com\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Please mention the Job ID in the email.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Please apply in English via the apply button.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We kindly draw your attention to the fact that this email may NOT be used for sending applications or CVs for evaluation.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   #Associate\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity\u002Fexpression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join us in creating a better future for our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for a Tender Manager to join our Offshore Tender department, where you will be working on Sales projects for the world leaders in Offshore Wind. You will be responsible for the technical, budgetary, commercial and contractual proposals for the construction of Offshore Wind Turbines projects for our customers.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Based in either our Warsaw or Gdansk office, you will be a member of our Offshore Wind Tender Department, working on Sales projects globally. The Offshore Tender department consists of colleagues from many different professional and cultural backgrounds, who are united in their passion to provide winning solutions for offshore wind projects, that are a major part of the transition to renewable energy.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a member of the core Sales project team, you will define technical, logistical and commercial solutions for Construction and Installation of Offshore Wind Turbines, based on the customer's requirements and Siemens Gamesa best practice. You will create accurate, transparent and competitive budgets for the construction of Offshore Wind farms, including transport, pre-assembly operations, harbors, construction, commissioning, back office staffing, blue-collar manpower and vessel scopes. You will provide project specific contract schedules for the construction scope and time schedules for the project execution phase.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You professionally and actively communicate with our customers regarding Construction and Installation Scope for Sales projects, supporting and guiding the customer’s expectations for technical, logistical and commercial solutions, which will provide them with the best set up for their project. You will participate in the Customer negotiations, leading the Construction and Installation scope costs and contract schedules packages.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. You also hold a strong business acumen, preferably gained within a technical orientated business environment. Furthermore, you are having knowledge of Tender and Procurement processes and contract &amp; risk management from large scale industrial projects is preferential.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You have extensive Contract experience, preferably from a large scale \u002F complex business environment, personally working with and negotiating contract terms and conditions. You have extremely strong relationship building skills, both internally across different functions and externally towards our customers.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You are likely to have 5 – 10 years of experience from an industrial business area. Experience from the renewables industry will be an advantage, although not a prerequisite. It is likely that you have a relevant higher-level education and a successful track record within similar positions but are keen to learn and develop your knowledge and skills further.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a person, you are structured and analytical, but with a pragmatic and flexible mind-set to adapt to the evolving business needs. You enjoy working in a fast-paced global industry and being part of a competitive Sales team. You have extensive experience of working in an international business environment and understand how to operate with an extended network, based out with your regional locale. You are international in your mindset and enjoy and embrace working across different cultures within a global business environment.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Lastly, you have advanced proficiency in written and spoken English, being able to communicate both orally and in writing at the highest professional level and possess a general IT flair, especially in MS Excel.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> In case you have acquired your skills in alternative ways your application is just as well appreciated.<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package and local benefits such as subsidised lunch, employee discounts and much more.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has a progressive approach to working in a digital environment and our flexible working policies mean that many of our employees choose to work from home for a portion of the working month. This possibility to work from home, means that it is not a hard requirement that you are within a traditional daily commuting distance of the office location.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Other information\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   If you have specific questions about the position, please contact the hiring manager Roderick McNeil via phone +45 3016 6686\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For further information regarding the recruitment process, please send the recruiting team an email via aysu.gunduz.ext@siemensgamesa.com. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <br> We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <br> In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity, and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <br> \n <br> You will join our New Product Engineering team in Offshore Equipment which is responsible for cutting-edge technology designs for all standard lifting and transport solution for our new Offshore turbines. The team is closely cooperating with the turbine development modules, making sure all brand-new turbine designs can be transported and lifted in the future on time and on cost.\n <br> New Product Engineering team in Offshore Equipment is also closely linked to the Sales &amp; Execution organization which takes care of all customer, country, and harbor specific requirements.\n <div>\n   You will be a key player in approaching the next generations of challenges within the Equipment (EQ) department who has the global responsibility of creating all equipment for storage and transportation of the offshore wind turbines. Furthermore, transportation analysis of both onshore and offshore including lifting and sea-fastening are a part of the scope.\n  <br> EQ takes care of deﬁning the project speciﬁc equipment for all execution projects with all the project speciﬁc challenges in mind. As a marine engineer, you will be a part of a strong and dedicated team composed by a group of engineers with various specialties ensuring that all necessary issues in each execution project is dealt with. The strongest tool for this to succeed is teamwork.\n  <br> You will work with many different interfaces and have stakeholder and project management responsibility for different maritime operations.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Qualifications\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>Master’s Degree in Marine engineering\u002F Naval architecture or similar<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Minimum 5 years of professional experience within Offshore transportation and installation engineering (T&amp;I Engineering)<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Sound knowledge of engineering software such as Orcaflex, CAD, AQWA, Autoship, and Mathcad<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Hands on experience in International Codes &amp; Standards of Maritime Industry, mainly DNV, ABS, Eurocode, ISO, IMCA, OCIMF and IMO regulations<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Good knowledge of Seafastening design and relative guidelines<\u002Fli>\n  <li>High understanding of heavy lift operations<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Good knowledge of WTG installation vessels, DP vessels, and RORO\u002FLOLO vessels for WTG transports<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Familiar with floating structures and relative hydrodynamic aspects<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Good knowledge of MWS, BIMCO charter party agreement, and CAR policy<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Well familiar with wind loads and Vortex Induced Vibration (VIV) for tall structures<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Demonstrate team spirit, analytical skill, and good communication skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Interpret Metocean Report and Site survey report<\u002Fli>\n  <li>General HSE knowledge and awareness of QA\u002FQC processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Fluent in English<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n  <br> Responsibilities \u002F Functions\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>Assist project construction and operations managers with the marine issues during the execution phase<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Provide technical and operational insights to sales department for charter party agreement and other sales topics<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Liaise with new product development and providing technical marine insights for various topics like Seafastening design, transport, and lift instructions, lifting plan, vessel stability and motions, or lifting aids design<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Liaise with MWS as a marine lead to ensure related documents for offshore execution obtain adequacy certificate<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Liaise with clients, vessel owners, third party, and subcontractors to achieve project requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Prepare MWS package for load out, transport and installation of WTG components and equipment for various projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Review motion analysis, dynamic heavy lift analysis, Seafastening, rigging design, and mooring<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Provide weight report for equipment and WTG components<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Participate actively in risk assessment &amp; Lessons Learnt workshop<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Maintain a positive Work ethic and guide others to work safely and efficiently, align with Company Policies and Guidelines<\u002Fli>\n <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity, and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for an experienced Commercial Business Analyst for our Offshore Business Controlling Team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a Commercial Business Analyst you will provide financial and administrative support to management and act as a trusted partner for the technical organizations. You will work closely with technical heads and controllers in DK, DE, TW and UK to ensure high data quality and forecast accuracy on their Cost Centers. More specifically, your main responsibilities will cover:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Cost Center Controlling:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Conducting Cost Center controlling and Management reporting<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Preparation of financial budgets and forecasts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Performing ad hoc analyses, reporting and controlling task<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Investigating and understanding deviations and abnormalities between financial submissions (Budget, Forecast, Actuals) and ensuring detailed commenting<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Timely and correct invoicing \u002F cost transfer for services and deliverables provided by the department<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will be the main contact person for all commercial topics related to your specific area of responsibility<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Other responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Act as key user for various systems (S4\u002FHANA, etc) as required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Responsible for data consolidation and analysis for global departments<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide guidance to local controllers and coordinate the closing and forecasting activities for your function from global perspective<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Improvement for digitalization in the commercial process (using PowerBI, Alteryx, SQL etc.)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You are passionate for renewable energy and have a sense for the importance to make real what matters and lead the change. You hold a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics or Business Administration or similar.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You have more than 3 years' experience in commercial or controlling areas, previous experience from accounting, reporting and controlling tasks in complex environment will be an advantage.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a person you are result-\u002Fsolution-oriented, well-structured, diligent and a dedicated team player with strong analytical skills.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Good command of SAP and Microsoft Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Access, VBA) is required, experience with SQL, PowerBI, Alteryx preferred\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You possess excellent English skills, both orally and in writing.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills and are capable of working with people from different cultures and organizational levels\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come.. A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy. Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality. Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. Flexible working hours as well as home-office. Attractive remuneration package. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join us in creating a better future for our planet. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization. For our Offshore Construction department, we are now recruiting for a Pre- Assembly &amp; Harbour Planning Manager for our Port &amp; Harbor Services Team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a Pre- Assembly &amp; Harbor Planning Manager, you will be responsible for planning preassembly according to best practice and project requirements. Facilitate contractor selection process in line with relevant functions and key stakeholders.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Some of the tasks and responsibilities you can expect to be involved in include:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>Provide input into the projects EHS Plan(s) and where relevant ensure plans are shared with 3rd party suppliers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ensure the preassembly ports EHS requirements are considered, and relevant requirements are captured within the project EHS Plan(s)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n   -Ensure site layouts are completed for preassembly sites including details relating to tower packs, laydown areas, office \u002F warehouse locations, transportation routes etc. - Ensure Preassembly Project Specific Lean workflows are created and used for scheduling and resource planning.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>Create project specific plans to include; Mob &amp; Demob Plans, Preassembly Security Plans, Preassembly Manning Plan and more<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Work with project team and supporting functions to ensure preassembly project specific manuals and checklists are obtained from Engineering and reviewed before mobilization.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Plan according to project budgets and support CNPM during monthly MIKA \u002F forecast processes.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Complete handover to CNPM, Site Managers &amp; Installations Leads prior to mobilization. Periodically complete reviews of project during execution works to verify planning v's actuals. Input into relevant standards through lessons learned.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Participate in the sales and tender activities (sales, planning and executions phases) in relation to preassembly scope.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   A passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are also looking for:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>Technical background with mechanical\u002F constructional experience in wind industry<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You have a prior profound knowledge site and engineering,<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You have min. 3-5 years of experience, preferably from a similar position in an international organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You are talented at multi stakeholder management and achieve your results through great negotiation skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You are persistent, solution oriented and you possess an intercultural understanding<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You have excellent communication and English skills, both speaking and in writing<\u002Fli>\n  <li>People management and good communication capabilities, ability to inspire others showing commitment to achieving targets \u002F goals.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Demonstrates good decision-making skills and takes responsibility for decisions taken.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Can develop an environment in which others can work to the best of their abilities allowing creative and innovative thoughts and ideas<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity, and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For our Offshore Project Controlling team we are looking for a Project Controller in Gdansk, Poland (alternatively Paris). As Project Controller you are the Financial Business Partner to both Commercial Project Manager as well for Technical Project Managers. You will be part of different international project teams and will interface with colleagues in Accounting and Business Controlling.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As Project Controller you are responsible for controlling, planning, and reporting of assigned construction contracts in Germany, France, and other countries. The role is focused on Project Financial KPIs for Profit and Loss, Balance Sheet and Free Cash Flow. The tasks can vary as the project execution progress in the design, manufacturing, and installation of the wind turbines, but the KPIs are reported on monthly basis. Tasks in the project controller responsibility:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>Manage the forecast process by organizing reviews and managing data from stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Analyze actuals and cost to complete for the project; explain deviations using cost drivers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Implement financial forecast in SAP4HANA and contribute to monthly reporting for your projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Support Commercial Project Manager and Management team with ad hoc requests.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Contribute with expertise on financial topics e.g. VAT, Tax, Export control, Internal Controls.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As Project Controller you will also be part of a Global Project Controlling team and thereby getting the chance to contribute to improvement projects or key user activities e.g. process descriptions, work optimization solutions, IT system testing, training other colleagues.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As personal profile we are looking for a candidate who can meet following or similar criteria:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You are passionate about renewable business and want to learn a lot in the job.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You are a team player, and you take ownership and contribute to the success of the project.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You are structured, organized and can keep the overview while deep diving into details.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You are valuing open and direct communication and constructive feedback.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You are motivated by working in a dynamic, changing environment.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As qualifications we are looking for a candidate who can meet following or similar criteria:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You have a university degree in Finance, Accounting, International Business or Finance &amp; IT.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You know your way around out IT landscape IT (Excel, SAP, Power BI) and like working with and structuring big data.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You have 1 - 3 years’ experience in Accounting \u002FControlling\u002F Audit field (full time\u002Finternship).\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You have a solid understanding of and experience with percentage-of-completion accounting as well as a general knowledge about local taxes and accounting rules.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You possess excellent English skills, both orally and in writing. German and\u002For French language skills are an advantage.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You are looking forward to travel occasionally.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy. Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality. Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. Flexible working hours as well as home-office. Attractive remuneration package. Local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Other Information\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   If you have specific questions about the position, please contact the hiring manager Oliver Putze via mail \n  <div>\n   oliver.putze@siemensgamesa.com\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For further information regarding the recruitment process, please contact primary recruiter, Selin Kanalici via \n  <div>\n   selin.kanalici.ext@siemensgamesa.com\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Please mention the Job ID in the email.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Please apply in English via the apply button.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We kindly draw your attention to the fact that this email may NOT be used for sending applications or CVs for evaluation.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity, and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a Proposals Sales Manager you will be the one to develop the most competitive technical solution and scope. Initiate the cost calculations using approved tools to reflect internal cost basis, supplier \u002F subcontractor prices and margins in line with business targets. You will also need to review invitations to tenders to find customer requirements and identify the project drivers - ensuring that all deliverables are produced in accordance with the tender program by collaborating in meetings about tender co-ordination, reviews etc.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will be supporting the Account Managers in business development activities, e.g., preparation of required pre-qualification documentation \u002F submissions, customer events, and product presentations. During contract negotiations, you will negotiate technical contract conditions and completing technical solution packages. Your work will be team based, joining forces with other team members being the Account Manager, Commercial Sales Manager, Cost Manager and Contract Manager.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The role also covers these responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Developing and maintaining excellent working relationships with internal expert functions within Construction, Logistics, Project, Service and Engineering departments.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensuring that all activities are conducted in a professional and ethical manner and in full compliance with company procedures, protocols, governance etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Some travel activities must be expected in this role.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Besides a passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change, we are also looking for:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> A motivating team player, who is resilient, responsible, and structured with excellent communication skills. You interact with stakeholders high and low in the organization as well as external stakeholders. You are motivated by providing quality results within the deadlines and are happy to work in a dynamic organization and environment. Furthermore, you possess working knowledge of Microsoft office package.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The ideal candidate preferably has a bachelor’s or a master’s or degree in Engineering, Global Business Engineering or similar just as a significant experience with project bidding and negotiation in large-scale organizations would be an asset. It will be an advantage if you have you have knowledge of and experience from the wind industry.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We look for a self-motivated person, creative, passionate, and able to acclimate into a fast-paced dynamic environment – and capable of multitasking in a complex organization. You should also be\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   an excellent communicator with great people skills and good persuasive ability. The role has a wide range of stakeholders, so resilience and confident networking is key. You need to demonstrate pragmatic judgement, balancing pace, risk, and business value to reach decisions which are well informed. You need to establish and maintain constructive and collaborative business relationships with all business areas and regional team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> It is a big advantage if you thrive in a multi-cultural environment and are familiar with working in large organizations. It is therefore important that you have excellent English language skills, both written and spoken. Knowledge of Scandinavian languages is an advantage.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> In case you have acquired your skills in alternative ways your application is just as well appreciated.<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come.. A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy. Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality. Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. Flexible working hours as well as home-office. Attractive remuneration package. Local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more..\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   If you have specific questions about the position, please contact the hiring manager Johannes Elsner via \n  <div>\n   johannes.elsner@siemensgamesa.com\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For further information regarding the recruitment process, please contact primary recruiter,\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Selin Kanalici via \n  <div>\n   selin.kanalici.ext@siemensgamesa.com\n  <\u002Fdiv> Please mention the Job ID in the email.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Please apply in English via the apply button. Please apply with both CV and cover letter.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We kindly draw your attention to the fact that this email may NOT be used for sending applications or CVs for evaluation.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity\u002Fexpression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet. We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization. We have an exciting opportunity for a Technical Sales Project Manager to be located at our office in Warsaw, Poland. Come join our international team spread across the globe, working in a matrix organization and being responsible for sales of offshore wind turbine contracts to improve the climate and the lives for everybody on earth. Learn more about the role from one of your future colleagues here:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a Technical Sales Project Manager in our market unit Offshore, you will have the overall responsibility for managing technical scope of the sales phase. You will also be a contact point for our customers, ensuring that our offered solution packages meet customer tender requirements. You will subsequently negotiate the contractual terms of the turbine supply agreements with our customers.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>You will lead the technical sales project team from bid preparation and submission; to contract negotiation and signing; and finally, handover the project to the execution team<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You will take the lead in defining and developing the best technical solutions in co-operation with clients, the sales team and in-house experts<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You will lead the negotiations of the technical requirements and specifications of Turbine Supply Agreements supported by the technical sales project team<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You will establish a solid planning of your sales projects including plans for Design, bid preparation and Technical Due Diligence<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You will drive the internal technical review of client’s tender material and final contracts incl. defining technical risks and deviations<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You are responsible for providing the cost input for the technical solutions to the sales calculations including SCADA and tower quotations, features and options<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You will report the project status to the Sales Project Manager as well as ensure alignment across the relevant organizational entities (such as Product Portfolio Management (PPM), Engineering (S&amp;PR EN) and Technology (TE)) that provide support to your projects<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance of leading the change is important. We are also looking for a person with experience from international large-scale project management and\u002For sales projects, preferably from the energy or entrepreneurial sector.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Furthermore, you have previous experience with and have managed complex sales projects with multicultural teams and with highly professional customers.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We’re seeking a highly motived individual who is keen on working with the cutting edge of renewable energy. Having an interest in wind turbine technology, thriving in multinational environments, and having strong project management skills are key elements of achieving success in the role as a technical sales manager.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The ideal candidate should:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>Preferably hold a M.Sc. within Engineering (or similar) coupled with a good business acumen<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Have gained several years of experience within the Wind Turbine industry preferably with experience from R&amp;D, project management or technical sales<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Have an understanding of the offshore environment in relation to large construction projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Be experienced in technical contract negotiations<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Furthermore, you are a result oriented, team player with;\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>Communication skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Negotiation skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Risk mitigation competencies<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Fluency in English, both written and oral.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality.
