<div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join us in creating a better future for our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity, and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Floating Offshore Wind is booming and SGRE wants to maintain its market leader position in this market. Within our Floating Offshore Wind team, we strive to make the best fit of our products for floating wind.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> As Service Expert for Floating Offshore Wind, you will bring excellent knowledge on offshore logistics and understand the impact of operation and maintenance on the overall business case. You are an expert in technology market research and translate the results into strategic development of future solutions. Would you like to be part this new and exciting journey?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In your role you will work closely with colleagues from execution, heavy lift, turbine development and HSE.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In the position to be staffed you would contribute to our vision with the following tasks.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Map current concepts for main component exchange (MCE) in floating OF wind, identify gaps or challenges and identify additional\u002Finnovative concepts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Evaluate MCE-concepts from service perspective, whilst considering relevant interfaces, e.g., impact on tower, nacelle, transition piece and\u002For foundation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Shortlist most promising MCE-concepts (from SGRE point of view as well as from customer business case perspective)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Initiate development of required adaptations or new concepts. Ensure alignment with relevant stakeholders in the organization such as service, execution, heavy lift, turbine development and HSE.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are looking for you to\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Hold a Master’s degree or equivalent within offshore logistics, offshore engineering, or mechanical engineering, coupled with at least 5 years of relevant professional experience.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have experience in offshore service, ideally including floating offshore wind.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are able to combine technical challenges and financial optimization and have an understanding of the impact of technical solutions on the overall business case.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are able to gain commitment and engagement by influencing key stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are systematic and persistent in the tasks you take on and are driven by achieving results.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are a self-driven team worker and can work independently.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Your English skills are excellent, both orally and in writing.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are experienced in working across functions and across organizational levels<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You thrive in a multi-cultural environment and are familiar with working in large organizations. Since your team is located across Europe, some travel can be expected (approx. 10% of the time).We are an equal opportunity employer and aim to increase diversity in our management team.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> We welcome applications from candidates of a variety of backgrounds no matter gender, race, religion, age, nationality, or sexual orientation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> In case you have acquired your skills in alternative ways your application is just as well appreciated.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in any of the following areas is an advantage: offshore logistics, offshore operation and maintenance, service operations. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. You have a bachelor’s or Master`s degree in Finance, Economics, or similar. Ideally, you have a minimum of 2 years of experience in financial reporting, capital markets, preferably from within the renewable energy sector. English with full professional competence.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Previous experience on Financial Modelling<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have advanced skills and experience within SQL coding; Alternative you are S\u002F4 HANA advanced user<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience of Power BI and Power Automate are a plus.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in understanding the various types of data table formats<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have a result-oriented and hands-on approach to your job<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have excellent communication skills with a strong command of English, both written and spoken.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are strategic, proactive, and analytic in your approach, and you know how to handle a lot of data.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come.. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization. Read more about your future team and employees' stories \n  <div>\n   in our brochure\n  <\u002Fdiv>.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As our LV Engineer you will be working with project specific aviation and navigation solutions both in sales and execution phase.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our work is project driven and you will have wide scale international interfaces to clients, suppliers and colleagues. More specifically, you will be responsible for:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Review Tender material\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Specify requirements for suppliers\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Review and submit suppliers offer for Sales Project\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Prepare material for ordering and Sales Contract\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Coordinate FAT and SAT at suppliers\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Support Commissioning activities\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Internal subject matter expert within aviation and navigation marking\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Supplier communication\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Participate in customer meetings\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. Ideally, you have a technical background and a bachelor’s degree within electrical engineering, preferably combined with experience from the wind turbine business. It’s an advantage if you have experience with regulatory standards and have general understanding of OT and IT systems.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a person, you are self-driven, dedicated team player, extrovert, systematic, analytical and able to create and maintain an overview of complex tasks. At the same time, you are good at networking, and you possess excellent communication skills in English. Furthermore you:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     deliver high quality also under pressure.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     thrive in a multi-cultural environment.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     are motivated by working in a strong technical and customer-oriented environment. You must expect travel activity of 15-25 days a year.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> In case you have acquired your skills in alternative ways your application is just as well appreciated.<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Most importantly, you challenge yourself and your colleagues to achieve the best results. You have a high professional competency and ability to work by your own, and you have a desire to develop your skills. You have good collaboration and team working skills, and you can manage to act in different cultural contexts. To thrive in this position, you must have a strong result- and customer-oriented approach.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: We believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n  <br> We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n  <br> In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa is the market leader in Offshore Wind Power and is recognized for its groundbreaking technology, and its expansive presence in development, engineering and construction of Wind Turbines. \n  <i>We make real what really matters; clean energy for generations to come <\u002Fi>– and we are looking for additional support to our experienced team of around 30 Project Planners from all around the globe.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In the Siemens Gamesa offshore business unit, we drive and manage big scale projects, often lasting 3-4 years of time from the contract signature to final takeover of the wind farm. A strong focus on time, cost and scope is therefor essential in order to successfully execute the projects. Project schedules are born in the early sales phase and evolve throughout the project life cycle. To make sure these schedules are maintained we have the Project Planner.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Project Planner has a key role in managing the time schedules in our projects and directly supports the Project Manager with various planning, controlling and governing tasks. The Project Planner makes sure the schedule is at all times updated, maintained, analyzed and that it is communicated properly to the relevant stakeholders. The Project Planner creates scenarios for project optimization, risk analysis\u002F–mitigation, runs reports and creates visualizations and proposals to enforce important decision making.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For this position we're looking for a Project Planner to support us with our sales and tender time schedules, being closely involved with our sales teams and especially our Tender Managers.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will be part of a global planning team of over 30 Project Planners, where 4-5 of these are working with our sales projects. There are thus great opportunities for learning and sharing knowledge between people and across borders.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   If this sounds exciting to you, please read on.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What are my responsibilities?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The key responsibilities are within developing, updating and maintaining the sales and tender time schedules for the offshore wind turbine projects we are bidding on. You will further be responsible for tasks connected to e.g. monthly internal reporting, contract reviewing, schedule analysis and key stakeholder alignment regarding different planning deliverables.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Your responsibilities and duties will also include:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Developing contractual and operational time schedules<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Preparing scenario planning to evaluate potential options<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Analyzing schedules and providing scenario plans for mitigation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintaining the accuracy of project plans according with project objectives<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Analyzing the schedule variance, risk and opportunity<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Preparing and presenting data to influence program decision making<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinating with project team to accelerate tasks and resolve problems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supporting the Project Portfolio team with inputs from your project<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Giving feedback to the line organization on learnings and best practices<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Organize own workload to ensure your time is utilized effectively<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for a person with experience from planning and control environments.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Ideally you hold a MSc. degree within industry related fields, e.g. engineering or project management. You have a minimum of 3 years’ experience of working in major Projects (preferably from the Offshore or the Wind industry). You have knowledge of Engineering, Manufacturing, Procurement and Construction processes and you are comfortable using a variety of IT systems to fulfill different aspects of your scope, including all Microsoft Office applications; Expert level using Primavera P6, Microsoft Project or similar tools.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   PMI-SP® certification (or other PMI® certifications) would be an advantage.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a person you have a responsible approach to your work, taking ownership for what you do. You have a proactive, results-oriented focus; and are able to carry out your tasks in a dynamic environment. You are willing and capable of assuming additional responsibilities; to work autonomously, and to commit to stringent deadlines. It is important for this role that you have strong interpersonal skills as you will interact and work with people at all levels in the organization. You are able to work in an international environment having excellent English skills, both orally and in writing\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> In case you have acquired your skills in alternative ways your application is just as well appreciated.<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as 50\u002F50 office and home-office split, attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable) and local benefits such as subsided lunch, fitness club card and much more.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Other information\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For further information regarding the recruitment process, please contact the primary recruiter Aysu Gunduz through email: \n  <div>\n   aysu.gunduz.ext@siemensgamesa.com\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Please mention the Job ID in the email.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Please apply in English via the apply button.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We kindly draw your attention to the fact that this email may NOT be used for sending applications or CVs for evaluation.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   #Associate\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. Siemens Gamesa does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, ethnicity, nationality, ancestry, genetic information, citizenship, religion, age, gender, gender identity\u002Fexpression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, rules or regulations. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> We are now recruiting for an Installation Lead position for Offshore Construction. The primary purpose of this role will be responsibility for the first line supervision and direction of the teams assigned to you and to ensure the safe, timely and effective execution of the work activities. This role reports to the Head of Site Management and Installation Leads.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Installation Lead will in accordance with the contract and EHS \u002F QA systems be responsible for the daily planning and execution of works within an individual area and function of the construction site as directed by Site Management. You will ensure that all work is performed in agreement with all SGRE standards including QA regulations. You will perform continuous evaluation and feedback of the technicians within your teams to ensure capabilities and skills are maintained and where necessary improved to the required standards. You will implement, continuously improve and optimize processes, workflows and standards to standardize execution and create a safe working environment.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Some of your key tasks will include but not be limited to:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Provide visible, strong and active EHS leadership within the project, acting as a champion of Zero Harm. Responsible to ensure that EHS standards, procedures and plans are implemented, to create a Zero Harm environment and to perform within your leading function as a role model.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support and contribute to EHS matters in the various planning meetings during the project planning phase and then ensuring the assessment, documentation and certification process is in place during the project execution phase.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure all personnel operating within your area of responsibility (including contractors) are competent to undertake their work and are aware of all EHS related information.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure work proceeds in accordance with all required documentation, permits, RAMS, etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure that the quality of work undertaken by your teams result in no additional non-standard work, by driving a Zero Defect culture in all areas.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure full adherence to Lean workflows, reporting on deviations and implementing remedial measures to prevent reoccurrence – drive, implement and manage the Lean process throughout all areas.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure correct allocation of registered working hours for the teams. Monitor, control and mitigate all excessive working hours at site.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The successful candidate will be an experienced leader with proven track record in large international manufacturing or industrial environments and possessing in-depth technical knowledge of wind turbine products. You will be able to handle conflicts and be a solution orientated individual who can understand technical issues, work processes and activities at site and who is a team player able to maintain high performing teams.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will have experience of working within the Offshore industry and have a solid understanding of the work processes at project sites. You will also be EHS and Quality focussed and be able to identify risks before they happen and have solid knowledge and understanding of SGRE Sphera, QA and EHS processes.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   To be successful in this role, you will have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Lastly, as this role requires you to work and be based at our project sites globally, you will be willing and able to travel anywhere as required, working on a rotational basis both onshore and offshore.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable) and local benefits such as subsided lunch, You will work closely with technical heads and controllers in DK, DE, TW and UK to ensure high data quality and forecast accuracy on their Cost Centers. More specifically, your main responsibilities will cover:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Cost Center Controlling:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Conducting Cost Center controlling and Management reporting<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Preparation of financial budgets and forecasts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Performing ad hoc analyses, reporting and controlling task<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Investigating and understanding deviations and abnormalities between financial submissions (Budget, Forecast, Actuals) and ensuring detailed commenting<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Timely and correct invoicing \u002F cost transfer for services and deliverables provided by the department<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will be the main contact person for all commercial topics related to your specific area of responsibility<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Other responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Act as key user for various systems (S4\u002FHANA, etc) as required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Responsible for data consolidation and analysis for global departments<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide guidance to local controllers and coordinate the closing and forecasting activities for your function from global perspective<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Improvement for digitalization in the commercial process (using PowerBI, Alteryx, SQL etc.)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You are passionate for renewable energy and have a sense for the importance to make real what matters and lead the change.
